oncoPharmaDB 0.4.1

Function that accepts a ChEMBL molecule identifer and uses the ChEMBL web service API to return a range of compound properties

chembl_compound_properties.Rd

Function that accepts a ChEMBL molecule identifer and uses the ChEMBL web service API to return a range of compound properties

chembl_compound_properties(
  chembl_ws_base_url = "https://www.ebi.ac.uk/chembl/api/data",
  molecule_chembl_id = NA
)

Arguments

molecule_chembl_id

ChEMBL molecule identifier

Value

a data frame with the following columns of chemical compound properties:

  • molecule_chembl_id

  • parent_chembl_id

  • chembl_acd_logp

  • chembl_acd_logd

  • chembl_acd_most_apka

  • chembl_acd_most_bpka

  • chembl_alogp

  • chembl_aromatic_rings

  • chembl_full_molformula

  • chembl_full_mwt

  • chembl_hba

  • chembl_hba_lipinski

  • chembl_hbd

  • chembl_hbd_lipinski

  • chembl_heavy_atoms

  • chembl_molecular_species

  • chembl_mw_freebase

  • chembl_mw_monoisotopic

  • chembl_num_alerts

  • chembl_num_lipinski_ro5_violations

  • chembl_num_ro5_violations

  • chembl_psa

  • chembl_qed_weighted

  • chembl_ro3_pass

  • chembl_rtb

  • chembl_canonical_smiles

  • chembl_standard_inchi

  • chembl_standard_inchi_key

  • chembl_pref_name

  • lincs_id

  • drugbank_id

  • pharmgkb_id

Examples

## Retrieve compound properties for IRINOTECAN (ChEMBL molecular compound ID = 'CHEMBL481')
if (FALSE) {
chembl_compound_props(molecule_chembl_id = 'CHEMBL481')
}
